title: Item 9 and 10 on fl100
question: I filed fl100 with a help from a firm where they help you fill the papers. The original intent where both my husband and I agreed verbally to sign a MSA in front of the helper, so she mentioned to click 9 a) There are no such assets or debts that I know of to be confirmed by the court and 10 a) There are no such assets or debts that I know of to be divided by the court.
question_tags: Divorce,Equitable distribution in divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers: So you went to a paralegal who committed UPL. Bummer. You would be wise to file an amended petition. Even wiser... pay a lawyer to assist you.
You need to go back to help you file and ask them about the form they helped you fill out.

You got bad legal advice regarding the FL-100. It is best, now to amend the petition and response to reflect that you either have assets/ liabilities to divide or that the assets and liabilities, both community and of separate property character are not yet known at this time. Then, go and get legal assistance as I think you might be putting yourself into a bad place without a proper and fair distribution of both assets and liabilities in this marriage.
